lines.content: * Molly bot class containing static methods that help Molly interact with user.
"todo (description) - creates a new todo", "deadline (description) /by (end time or date) - creates a deadline",
"event (description) /from (start time or date) /to (end time or date) - creates an event",
"mark (task number) / unmark (task number) - marks or unmarks your tasks as done",
* Processes user inputs and manipulates the task array accordingly.
public static void main(String[] args) throws MollyException {
* Handles the different user inputs and decides what actions to perform for each of them.
public void handleUserInput(String userInput) throws MollyException {
throw new MollyException("Please select a valid task number.");
throw new MollyException("Invalid command. Please enter a valid task number to mark.");
throw new MollyException("Invalid  mark/unmark command. Please use 'mark/unmark (task number)'.");
throw new MollyException("Please select a valid task number.");
throw new MollyException("Invalid command. Please enter a valid task number.");
throw new MollyException("Invalid  delete command. Please use 'delete (task number)'.");
throw new MollyException("Invalid find command. Please use 'find (search term)'.");
throw new MollyException("Yikes! Sorry, the todo description cannot be empty.");
throw new MollyException("Yikes! Sorry, the description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
throw new MollyException("Sorry, invalid format for deadline. Please follow the format: deadline (description) /by (end date). The end date can be in the format DD-MM-YYYY HHmm (24 hour format).");
System.out.println("Yikes! Sorry, the description of an event cannot be empty.");
Event newEvent = new Event(description, from, to);

throw new MollyException("Sorry, invalid format for event. Please follow the format: event (description) /from (start date or time) /to (end date or time). The start and end date/times can be in the format DD-MM-YYYY HHmm (24 hour format)");
throw new MollyException("I'm sorry, I do not know how to respond to that. Type '/help' for the list of allowed commands.");
* Loads tasks from the Molly.txt file, creating new tasks for each line and adding them to the botMemory ArrayList.
* Parses tasks when reading the Molly.txt file, returning the tasks so that they
* can be added to the botMemory ArrayList.
Event event = new Event(description, from, to);
* Saves all the tasks from the botMemory ArrayList into the Molly.txt file
* This task.Deadline class extends task.Task and represents deadlines with a specified end date.
public final DateTimeFormatter INPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd-MM-yyyy HHmm");
public final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy h:mma");
* Checks if the deadline can be parsed to LocalDateTime object
return taskIsDone ? "[D][X] " + this.description + " (by: " + deadlineString + ")" : "[D][ ] " + this.description + " (by: " + deadlineString + ")";
* task.Event class that extends the task.Task class, with startTime and endTime that are defined
public final DateTimeFormatter INPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd-MM-yyyy HHmm");
public final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy h:mma");
* Checks if the startTime and endTime can be parsed as LocalDateTime objects
public Event(String description, String startTime, String endTime) {
return taskIsDone ? "[E][X] " + this.description + " (from: " + beginning + " to: " + end + ")" : "[E][ ] " + this.description + " (from: " + beginning + " to: " + end + ")";
* task.Task class that is used as the baseline class for defining tasks that Molly saves.
* Overrides toString method for printing of todo tasks
* Allows the user to toggle whether the task is marked as completed or not.
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Returns all the items in the ArrayList as a task list.
outputString.append("Here are the tasks in your list: \n");
System.out.println("There are no items in the list at the moment, enter '/help' to find out how to enter them.");
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list: ");
* Toggles the boolean value corresponding to whether the task is finished or not.
* Removes tasks from the ArrayList and informs the user.
System.out.println("Now you have " + botMemory.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Adds tasks to the ArrayList and informs the user.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task: ");
System.out.println("Now you have " + botMemory.size() + " task(s) in the list.");
"todo (description) - creates a new todo", "deadline (description) /by (end time or date) - creates a deadline",
"event (description) /from (start time or date) /to (end time or date) - creates an event",
"mark (task number) / unmark (task number) - marks or unmarks your tasks as done",
* This static method prints a line for Molly's user interface
* This is a public static method that makes Molly greet the user.
System.out.println("I am a virtual assistant designed to help you plan your tasks.");
System.out.println("What can I do for you? For a guide, enter the '/help' command");
* This is a public static method that makes Molly say bye.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
assertEquals("Invalid command. Please enter a valid task number to mark.", exception.getMessage());
assertEquals("Yikes! Sorry, the todo description cannot be empty.", exception.getMessage());

assertEquals("Sorry, invalid format for deadline. Please follow the format: deadline (description) /by (end date). The end date can be in the format DD-MM-YYYY HHmm (24 hour format).", exception.getMessage());

assertEquals("Sorry, invalid format for event. Please follow the format: event (description) /from (start date or time) /to (end date or time). The start and end date/times can be in the format DD-MM-YYYY HHmm (24 hour format)", exception.getMessage());
